title: Ping going from 50-200plus.
body:
Hi I am with telstra, I pay 90 a month, but right now I am getting major fluctuation with my ping. Did an aram, my team raged at me stating I was trolling, but my ping was going crazy. I usually sit at 32-33 ping constant. pulled the network cables out of the other 2 comps and turned the wireless off. It didn't help. Just wondering if there is ping issues or if anyone else with telstra paying a premium amount is having trouble with ping fluctuations. 
 PS it has been fine for months even at this time of the evening when everyone is netflix'in their butts off. I want to play a few more arams, but am scared I will be reported or something stupid by ghetto kids high on drugs or something. 
PPS Some kid with his 2 friends on curse voice tried to get his friends all to report me. He did worst than me with my 100-200+ fluctuating ping. Whats wrong with this community, I told him Ive won over 2k arams and lost about the same. 50/50. He just didn't get it

replies.body:
Could you do the following for me,

* [Switch to a public DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq5)
* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and the direct url to your ICSI netalyzr results.

To address your concerns regarding the reports placed against you by your team, you have nothing to worry about unless you really were intentionally feeding during that game and multiple others.
